A woman aggressively demanded the ball, leading Feltwell to surrender it to protect his child. The incident went viral, branding the woman as the “Phillies Karen.” Despite the backlash against her, Feltwell urged for kindness.

title: 'You don't arrest Voltaire': Decoding France's history of protests
description: ​​This September, Paris burned, Rennes saw a bus ablaze, trains were halted in the southwest, and riot police clashed with demonstrators under the banner of “Bloquons Tout”—the “Block Everything” movement. Over 200 arrests on the first day, despite Macron deploying an astonishing 80,000 police nationwide. Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau accused the protestors of trying to create “a climate of insurrection.” To which the French reply: Mais bien sûr.

'Pakistan captain can win smaller event like Asia Cup': Suryakumar warned of 'banana peel'
description: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo suggests predicting winners in smaller tournaments like the Asia Cup is more complex than forecasting World Cups due to the influence of captains' horoscopes. While India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, are favorites, Lobo highlights Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha as a strong contender, potentially making the Asia Cup a challenge for India.

Arjun Tendulkar takes five-for in first match after engagement
description: Arjun Tendulkar marked his return to competitive cricket after seven months with a bang, securing a wicket on his first ball and achieving his first five-wicket haul of the season. Recently engaged to Saaniya Chandok, Arjun is balancing his personal milestones with his cricketing career.

title: Focused student, popular rapper: teachers in Bengaluru remember Balendra Shah, a contender to become Nepal’s next PM
Why the iPhone Air could be a confusing choice for Indian customers
Navya Nanda meets Apple CEO; Karisma's kids get assets worth Rs 1900 crore: Top 5 news
description: The Kapur family inheritance battle intensifies as Sunjay Kapur's mother claims a portion of his estate, while Karisma Kapoor's children are said to have received a substantial amount. Elsewhere, Navya Naveli Nanda visits Apple's headquarters, and Prajakta Koli cancels her Nepal trip due to ongoing protests. Shwetha Menon advocates for fixed working hours on film sets.

title: Suhas Subramanyam: Indian-origin Congressman raises voice on hate crimes against Hindus S
description: Congressman Suhas Subramanyam has strongly condemned the recent hate crimes targeting Hindu temples in the US, citing incidents in Indiana and Utah as part of a disturbing trend. Speaking at Capitol Hill, the first Indian-American from Virginia called for a comprehensive response, including increased funding to protect religious institutions.

Al Nassr’s billion-dollar business: Who’s the highest-paid star?
description: Al Nassr has emerged as a football powerhouse, fueled by massive investments and the acquisition of global talents like Cristiano Ronaldo, Sadio Mane and Mohamed Simakan. Ronaldo's arrival significantly boosted revenue and attracted other stars with lucrative contracts. The club's high salary structure, exemplified by Ronaldo's $275 million annual earnings, reshapes football's financial landscape.

title: Why Vivekananda’s Chicago speech marked India’s first moral presence in global discourse
ICC T20I Rankings: 3 Indians in Top 10 of both batters and bowlers list
description: India's strong T20I performance is highlighted in the latest ICC rankings, with three batters and three bowlers securing spots in the Top 10. Abhishek Sharma leads the batting chart, while Varun Chakravarthy spearheads the bowling attack. Hardik Pandya remains the top all-rounder, showcasing India's strength across all departments.

Rohit Sharma practising for Australia tour? Truth behind viral video
description: A resurfaced video of Rohit Sharma practicing sparked speculation about his return, but it was confirmed as old footage from the 2025 IPL season. Despite concerns raised by a recent hospital visit, Sharma has cleared a fitness test and is set to join Virat Kohli in the ODI series against Australia, marking their return to international cricket after a break.

title: PM Modi speaks to Meloni: Trade deal in focus; Ukraine conflict discussed
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni engaged in a phone conversation, reinforcing their dedication to strengthening the India-Italy Strategic Partnership. Discussions encompassed bilateral relations, trade collaborations, and pressing global matters, notably the conflict in Ukraine. Modi expressed gratitude for Italy's support in finalizing a mutually advantageous India-EU trade agreement and advancing connectivity through the IMEEC initiative.

description: Nepal's Gen Z protest movement, fueled by anger over corruption and a social media ban, has selected former Chief Justice Sushila Karki as its interim leader. Karki's neutrality and respected civic standing made her the preferred choice to represent the protesters in upcoming negotiations amidst violent unrest and curfews in Kathmandu.

description: Gracie Hunt shared her family's awe-inspiring trip to Argentina's Iguazu Falls on Instagram, capturing the majestic waterfalls, diverse wildlife, and serene golden hours. Her photos and heartfelt captions highlighted the spiritual connection with nature and the joy of shared family moments amidst the stunning scenery. The journey was a blend of adventure, reflection, and lasting memories.

All eyes are on the highly anticipated clash between India and Pakistan on September 14.

Asia Cup 2025: Jitesh Sharma explains evolution of finishers in T20 cricket
description: Jitesh Sharma highlighted the adaptability needed for T20 finishers, noting the uncertainty they face compared to top-order batters. He argued that traditional matchup theories are outdated, as modern batters innovate against all bowlers. Sharma emphasised the responsibility finishers bear, especially during team collapses, requiring instinctive planning adjustments in today's dynamic T20 landscape.

title: Berlin replaces Boston: Germany emerges top choice for Indian students; Canada slips
description: Indian students’ study-abroad dreams are being redefined as traditional hubs like the US, UK, and Canada falter under visa curbs and rising costs. With Canada rejecting nearly 80% of applications and UK work visas plunging by half, Germany has emerged as the new epicenter. Affordable education, strong job pathways, and pragmatic value now outweigh colonial prestige.

description: Apple has discontinued the Plus-sized iPhone after a three-year run, replacing it with the new, slimmer, and lighter Air model priced at $999. The Plus, like the Mini before it, failed to attract enough buyers, as consumers preferred either the standard iPhone or the Pro models with enhanced features.

'If shedding blood …': Gen Z shakes Nepal – what do they want?
description: Nepal is witnessing violent protests led by its youth, triggered by a brief social media ban. The demonstrations, fueled by frustration over corruption and lack of opportunities, led to Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's resignation. Protesters are demanding systemic change, including the dissolution of parliament and fresh elections. Despite Oli's departure, unrest continues, highlighting deep-seated discontent among Nepal's young population.

'Closest to war since WW2': Russian drones over Poland push Europe to brink
description: Tensions surged as Russian drones breached Polish airspace, prompting Warsaw to invoke NATO's Article 4 and scramble allied forces. Several drones were shot down, marking a significant escalation as it's the first time a NATO member engaged Russian objects within its territory.

title: France unrest: Nearly 300 held; what triggered 'block everything' protests?
description: France is currently experiencing widespread protests fueled by public anger towards President Macron's government. Demonstrators clashed with police, blocked roads, and set fires in major cities, leading to over 200 arrests. The unrest stems from austerity measures and political instability, with unions and activists demanding change and further action is expected, raising concerns about continued disruption.

title: Taylor Swift walks hand in hand with Travis Kelce at 1587 Prime soft launch
description: Taylor Swift supported Travis Kelce at the soft launch of his Kansas City steakhouse, 1587 Prime, co-owned with Patrick Mahomes. The couple arrived hand-in-hand, enjoying an intimate evening with friends and family, including Chiefs teammates. Swift's presence highlighted both Kelce's business venture and their strong relationship as they celebrated the restaurant's opening.

title: 'Phillies Karen' identified & fired after taking Harrison Bader home run ball from young fan
description: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Drinking green tea may help combat Alzheimer’s – but with an added ingredient
description: Research indicates that combining green tea's antioxidant, EGCG, with nicotinamide (vitamin B3) may rejuvenate aging brain cells and help clear harmful protein buildup linked to Alzheimer's. Lab studies reveal this pairing restores energy in neurons, boosting their ability to clear amyloid-beta plaques. Regular green tea consumption is associated with sharper memory and lower dementia risk.
